Home → Recommendations & reviews → Young Adult

Young Adult

Are you interested in what makes us well? We've launched a new Open Space group for 11-17 year-olds at Chantry Library. Find out more →

Reviews, recommendations, posts and ideas for and by young adults.

Look after yourself this Libraries Week with our top YA wellbeing picks

Written by Sophie Green · Published Oct 8, 2018

Libraries Week runs from 8 - 13 October 2018. As this year's theme is wellbeing, we've put together a list of our favourite comforting and nurturing YA books.

Pick up a highly recommended book from the 2018 Books Are My Bag YA shortlist

Written by Sophie Green · Published Oct 5, 2018

The Books Are My Bag Readers Awards are curated by bookshops and voted for by book lovers. Young book lovers are invited to vote for their favourite for the chance to win a £100 book token, so why not check out the YA shortlist today?

The Wicked Deep by Shea Ernshaw

Written by Emily Mitchell · Published Oct 4, 2018

The Wicked Deep is dark, eerie and atmospheric.

Floored by various authors

Written by Amy Rush Da Silva · Published Oct 2, 2018

Floored is unique and heartwarming, with distinctive, realistic characters.

New Young Adult books for October 2018

Written by Sophie Green · Published Sep 28, 2018

New titles from Sarah J. Maas, Alex Wheatle, Adam Silvera & Becky Albertalli and more

The Surface Breaks by Louise O'Neill

Written by Emily Mitchell · Published Sep 27, 2018

The Surface Breaks is fierce, awesome and empowering.

Stranger by Keren David

Written by Amélie Magotte · Published Sep 25, 2018

Stranger will keep you hooked right until the last page.

On a Scale of One to Ten by Ceylan Scott

Written by Emily Mitchell · Published Sep 20, 2018

On a Scale of One to Ten is raw, dark and stunning.

Starfish by Akemi Dawn Bowman

Written by Amélie Magotte · Published Sep 18, 2018

Starfish shows an honest perspective of failure and what it means to be able to get back on your feet and try again.

Five minutes with... S. M. Wilson

Written by Emily Mitchell · Published Sep 17, 2018

Library volunteer Emily meets S. M. Wilson, author of the Extinction Trials series.

About our Young Adult section

Book reviews, reading suggestions and blog posts from our staff and young adult readers. Want to write for our website? Email us at help@suffolklibraries.co.uk.
